question.text: You are waiting to turn right at the end of a road. Your view is obstructed by parked vehicles. What should you do?

explanation.text: At junctions your view is often restricted by buildings, trees or parked cars. You need to be able to see in order to judge a safe gap. Edge forward slowly and keep looking all the time. Don’t cause other road users to change speed or direction as you emerge.

answer.text: Stop and then move forward slowly and carefully for a proper view
Move quickly to where you can see so you only block traffic from one direction
Wait for a pedestrian to let you know when it is safe for you to emerge
Turn your vehicle around immediately and find another junction to use
